page.title: 01Holmcroft's Area.
page.content: The area covered by our School included the northern part of Stafford,known as the "North End" and a large rural area on the North-north west of Stafford. Although three quarters of our area is rural,it included Doxey Marshes, a wildlife reserve, and the M6 junction No.14.The urban area consists of an Industrial Revolution type zone with houses and old shoe factories built about 1870,which has expanded over the years to the north of Stafford town as more houses were built and are still being built.
